dialogue: Turner here says you can keep your mouth shut, and that you're not a math dummy.
It used to be worse in the old days, from what my aunt says. But the State cracked down and now we only lay off the south campus stuff.
You mean the Negro students' stuff.
We had this good ole boy who used to run Nickel, Roberts, who would've sold the air you breathe if he could've. Now that was a crook!
It had to end up somewhere.
Turner! Get your nig- get your ass back over here. You have the key or not? I'm tired of your shit.
Goddamn baby. Waste of time, man. Head full of stump water.

I need you to head up to the farms and find Mr. Gladwell. Those men from the State aren't heading up there today. They're going to send some other experts for that. You find him and tell him he can relax.
I like the bleacher repair. We still need to paint, too. Can one of the little kids go?
I don't even know what Mr. Gladwell looks like, Mr. Harper, sir. Sir, I'd rather work on the bleachers.
Acting crazy today, all of you. He's got a straw hat and a farmer tan. You do what I asked you to do, and on Friday it's back to usual.
